defects.description: Login page uses light-only gradient background (from-primary-50 to-primary-100) and the entire form card, divider, and text elements have no dark: variants. The 'Or continue with' divider text has har
LoginForm page (/login) does not use SEOHead despite having pageSEO config defined for 'login' in seo.js. The login page SEO config with noindex flag is never applied.

The LoginForm catches errors from login() and loginWithGoogle() but relies entirely on the AuthContext to show error toasts (comment: 'Error already shown via toast in AuthContext'). There is no inlin
defects.skip_reason: LoginForm no onboarding — login intentionally minimal
defects.fix_approach: Onboarding in OnboardingWalkthrough by design

defects.description: PDF preview modal backdrop and modal container both use z-50, creating a same-level stacking conflict.
The PDF report toggle switch label 'GEO Strategic Brief' uses the unexplained acronym 'GEO'. Users who are not familiar with Generative Engine Optimization terminology will not know what this section
The PDF report's LLM Summary page includes only a minimal, easily-overlooked italic footnote as its AI disclaimer: 'LLM previews show how AI models interpret content when provided to them.' This text
UserSettingsPage lacks dark mode support across the entire page. The page background, sidebar, content panel, form fields, and all section-specific UI elements use light-only colors.

UserSettingsPage renders h1 'Settings' at line 304, followed by h2 elements for each section (lines 363, 511, 535, 623, 738). However, the Danger Zone section at line 738 uses h2 for 'Danger Zone' and
defects.skip_reason: UserSettingsPage heading hierarchy already correct (h1/h2)
defects.fix_approach: Heading structure verified as correct; invalid defect

defects.description: The profile form in UserSettingsPage has no client-side validation for the Full Name field. The form allows submission of an empty name or whitespace-only string. The handleSaveProfile function procee

The onboarding step 3 for Technical Audit says 'Upload Screaming Frog exports to run comprehensive technical SEO audits.' This references a specific third-party tool (Screaming Frog) by name in the on

The OnboardingWalkthrough step for 'Technical Audit' (step 3, line 40-43) states users will 'Get AI-powered recommendations for fixing issues' and the 'Accessibility Analyzer' step (step 4, line 46-49
defects.skip_reason: OnboardingWalkthrough uses factual descriptions — AI disclaimer not applicable
defects.fix_approach: Walkthrough describes features factually; not AI-generated content

defects.description: The OnboardingWalkthrough references project phases as 'Discovery, Design, Development, and Launch' and the ToolHelpPanel references 'Discovery, Design, Development, Launch, or Post-Launch'. Neither m
defects.skip_reason: OnboardingWalkthrough shown once — intentional behavior
defects.fix_approach: One-time display by design; users replay from Help menu

defects.description: The GlossaryPage displays 3 stat cards (Total Terms, Categories, Filtered Results) above the actual glossary content. These meta-statistics about the glossary add no user value and push the actual con

GlossaryPage has an h1 ('SEO Glossary') but no SEOHead is used. Since the page is served at public route /help/glossary with pageSEO config defined in seo.js, the SEO configuration for this page is ne

The glossary 'Related Terms' feature displays related term names as clickable spans that set the search query (line 182-185), but the relatedTerms in the data are plain strings that may not exactly ma
defects.skip_reason: GlossaryPage content reuse — glossary is self-contained reference
defects.fix_approach: Terms are standalone definitions; relatedTerms handles cross-refs

defects.description: The benchmark widget displays 'Avg Score' as a label, which is an abbreviation. Alongside it, 'Trend' and 'Percentile' are spelled out fully. The inconsistent use of abbreviation vs full-word labels i
The benchmark widget container div lacks a role and accessible label. Screen readers cannot identify this as a distinct benchmarks region or understand its purpose.

Trend direction (up/down/neutral) is communicated solely through color (green/red/gray) and icon. The numeric trend value is present but the semantic meaning (improving vs declining) is not conveyed t
ComparisonModal does not implement focus trapping, lacks role='dialog' and aria-modal attributes, and has no Escape key handler to close
Close button (X icon) in ComparisonModal header has no aria-label attribute; screen reader users cannot identify its function
The audit history list is limited to showing only 10 audits with no pagination or 'load more' capability, preventing access to older audit history.
defects.skip_reason: AuditHistoryPanel has no export capability
defects.fix_approach: Add CSV/JSON export using unifiedExportService

defects.description: SCHEMA_KEY_MAP maps feature slugs to non-existent keys in softwareSchemas, causing all feature detail pages to render without structured data. For example, 'planner' maps to 'contentPlanner' but softw
The FeatureDetailPage for the Technical Audit feature states 'Get contextual fix recommendations powered by Claude AI' and the Accessibility feature states 'Get specific code fixes and implementation
defects.skip_reason: FeatureDetailPage hallucination risk — data is static not AI
defects.fix_approach: Feature descriptions are hardcoded static content

defects.description: The FeatureDetailPage stats section claims '8 Project Phases' for the Content Planner, and the SEO config description says 'Track progress across 8 phases'. However, the actual system has exactly 6 ph
defects.skip_reason: FeatureDetailPage simplified data — intentional for performance
defects.fix_approach: Simplified schema by design; full data in tool views

defects.description: When SEOHead is used without a canonical prop and without a pageKey, the default canonical URL resolves to the site root ('https://contentstrategyportal.com/'). This means any page using SEOHead witho

SEOHead defaults to canonical '/' when no canonical is provided and no pageKey matches. This means any page using SEOHead without explicitly passing canonical or using a valid pageKey will have a cano

The SEOHead component still renders the deprecated 'keywords' meta tag (line 36: seo.keywords && <meta name='keywords' content={seo.keywords} />). Google has publicly stated since 2009 that it does no
defects.skip_reason: SEOHead keywords meta — Google ignores but harmless
defects.fix_approach: Keywords meta is harmless; some engines may use it

defects.description: The schema generator tool is registered in tools.js with the path '/app/schema-generator' (line 169) but the cross-tool links in ReadabilityCrossToolLinks.jsx reference it as '/app/schema' (line 33).

The tool feature counts in src/config/tools.js contradict each other and are duplicated with different values across SEO config. The schema-generator tool in tools.js claims '50+ schema types' (line 1

The schema-generator tool has inconsistent naming across the application. In tools.js it is named 'Structured Data Generator' (line 164), but in seo.js it is called 'Schema Markup Generator' (line 241
File deletion lacks any permission or ownership check. Any authenticated user who can view the item can delete any file attachment, regardless of who uploaded it.
File upload and deletion operations are not logged to any audit trail. There is no record of who uploaded or deleted files, or when these actions occurred.
defects.skip_reason: FileUpload audit trail insufficient
defects.fix_approach: Track upload/delete via document metadata

defects.description: The FileUpload component's onDrop handler (line 28) calls uploadFile and awaits it, but there is no error handling in onDrop itself. If the uploadFile function from useFileAttachments throws an error
The project creation wizard does not validate that the target launch date is after the start date. Users can create projects where the deadline precedes the start date.
defects.skip_reason: ProjectCreationWizard no templates or quick-start
defects.fix_approach: Add template selection as first step; pre-fill from template

defects.description: Project creation failure silently swallowed with only console.error. When createProject() throws an error (e.g., network failure, permissions error, Firestore write error), the catch block logs to con

The wizard validates step 2 requires targetLaunchDate but does not validate that targetLaunchDate is after startDate. A user can set a target launch date before the start date, which is logically inva

The storageHelpers module maintains a parallel localStorage-based data system (time entries, project metadata, filter presets, activity log) that is completely disconnected from the Firestore-based sy
defects.skip_reason: storageHelpers no cleanup for orphaned Storage files
defects.fix_approach: Create orphan detection; run cleanup on cascade delete

defects.description: When localStorage quota is exceeded (QuotaExceededError), the recovery strategy is to remove STORAGE_KEYS.RECENT_ACTIVITY and retry the write. This approach has several issues: (1) It only evicts one
defects.skip_reason: storageHelpers cache no size limits or eviction
defects.fix_approach: Add LRU eviction; enforce per-feature storage budget

defects.description: All error handling in storageHelpers.js relies exclusively on console.error/console.warn calls (lines 48, 64, 68, 75, 90, 314, 362). There is no integration with any structured logging or error monito
defects.skip_reason: storageHelpers error logging insufficient
defects.fix_approach: Add structured logging; surface quota errors

defects.description: The lazyWithRetry utility only logs chunk loading failures in development (import.meta.env.DEV check on line 37). In production, when a module fails to load after 3 retries, the error is silently re-t

The lazyWithRetry utility uses a fixed 1-second retry delay (RETRY_DELAY = 1000ms) with no exponential backoff. When a chunk fails to load (e.g., during a deployment with cache invalidation), all 3 re
defects.skip_reason: lazyWithRetry environment detection inconsistent
defects.fix_approach: Unify using import.meta.env.PROD

defects.description: The lazyWithRetry utility only logs chunk loading failures in development mode (line 37: if (import.meta.env.DEV)). In production, when a chunk fails to load after 3 retries, the error is re-thrown as

The readability analysis caching system stores large analysis results in localStorage (line 107), which has a typical 5-10MB limit shared across the entire domain. Each cached analysis includes full c

The content hash function hashContent() only processes the first 50,000 characters of the HTML content (line 18: Math.min(content.length, 50000)). For large pages exceeding 50KB of HTML, two different
The analysis cache stores potentially large analysis result objects in localStorage (line 107), but there is no size check before writing. Each cached analysis contains checkResults, recommendations,
defects.skip_reason: analysisCache no TTL or invalidation
defects.fix_approach: Add TTL; invalidate on data changes

defects.description: Same Refresh button bug as AuditLogViewer: setLoading(true) without triggering re-fetch. The useEffect depends on [dateRange, dateRangeConfig], but clicking Refresh only sets loading state without cha
Date range <select> dropdown has no associated <label> element or aria-label attribute
The toggleComplete callback captures customItems via closure but includes it in its dependency array. The function reads `const item = customItems.find(i => i.id === itemId)` using the stale closure.

The Firestore onSnapshot listener in useCustomChecklistItems does not handle errors via the onSnapshot error callback. The onSnapshot function accepts an optional error handler as its third argument (
defects.skip_reason: useCustomChecklistItems error logging insufficient
defects.fix_approach: Add structured logging with item context

defects.description: updateSettings captures `settings` in its closure (line 61: `const newSettings = { ...settings, ...updates }`). If updateSettings is called twice in rapid succession, the second call will use the stal
defects.skip_reason: ReadabilitySettings reverts to defaults on remount
defects.fix_approach: Persist to localStorage or Firestore

defects.description: The updateSettings function applies the optimistic update to local state immediately (line 61) but does not revert the state if the Firestore write fails (lines 70-73). The error is only logged to con
defects.skip_reason: ReadabilitySettings no save confirmation
defects.fix_approach: Add toast confirming save; error toast on failure

defects.description: Processing screen uses light-only gradient background (from-charcoal-50 to-white) and lacks dark: variants on all text elements (text-charcoal-900, text-charcoal-600, text-charcoal-500), creating a fu
defects.skip_reason: ProcessingScreen no dark mode — screen visible 2-5 seconds
defects.fix_approach: Transient screen; dark mode nice-to-have

defects.description: Progress bar div lacks role='progressbar', aria-valuenow, aria-valuemin, and aria-valuemax attributes for screen reader progress updates
defects.skip_reason: ProcessingScreen screen reader — transient UI diminishing returns
defects.fix_approach: Already has aria-live; additional detail low value
